title: Error Handling Patterns
excerpt: Designing user-friendly error messages and recovery flows.
content:
Error handling patterns are essential for creating a smooth user experience, even when things go wrong. Well-designed error messages can guide users to resolve issues and prevent frustration.

Key Principles

  • Clear Communication: Explain what went wrong in simple terms
  • Actionable Guidance: Provide steps to resolve the error
  • Appropriate Tone: Use a friendly, non-threatening tone
  • Visual Cues: Use color and icons to draw attention

Common Patterns

  1. Inline Validation for Forms
  2. Toast Notifications for Non-Critical Errors
  3. Modal Dialogs for Critical Errors
  4. 404 Pages for Missing Content
  5. Empty States for No Data Scenarios
